newsitem.title: FRANCE: Euro-MPs accept guidelines for telecoms operators.
newsitem.headline: Euro-MPs accept guidelines for telecoms operators.

text.p: The European Parliament on Thursday approved a draft directive which sets common European Union guidelines for issuing licences to telecommunications operators.
"A predictable licence environment is essential for the telecommunications industry and for the European citizen," parliament said in a report drafted by Dutch Christian Democrat Wim van Velzen.

Euro-MPs agreed it was important to have the new framework in place before the EU telecoms sector is fully liberalised in January 1998 and gave the directive -- COM(95)545 -- a second reading with only six amendments.
Among other things, these allow operators to provide new information technology services six weeks after lodging a request, unless the authorities can give clear reasons for rejection.
The directive needs the approval of both the parliament and the Council to become law.
